climbs.name: Unknown Legend
climbs.fa: Mike Ierien, Jon Stahl and Mike Tupper 1994

content.description: Must do route for the area! Quality climbing down low, with a nice rest midway up, leads to a great vertical to slightly over hanging finish to the climb. The crux comes at you consistently through the last 3 bolts. Technical hand sequences up high with no room for footwork error makes this a superb route.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Shares anchors with Postcards from Paradise 5.12 b/c to its' left.
content.location: Route shares 3 bolts with Postcards and then deviates right towards the obvious seam up high. Route can be TR'ed but the anchors are set down off the top of the climbs a bit. Creative anchor placement allows you to rappel or belay partner to anchors to set up TR.

content.description: Fun easier climbing up to a fixed draw where you encounter the bouldery crux

climbs.name: Even Smoke Jumpers Get the Blues

content.description: "Starts at lowest part of rock, traverses to prominent groove, and then follows line of bolts along the left edge of the face. Crux uses holds on blank face and featured shoulder...Variation: 5.10a Uses the formely "out of bounds" holds left of the face." - AAC
content.protection: 7 bolts, 2 rappel bolts up top can also be used to set up a top-rope.
content.location: Left most bolted route of main Rubble Pile Rock.

climbs.name: Barney Rubble
climbs.fa: Jon Stahl, Mike Tupper, Mike Ierien

content.description: The bottom part (15') is a bit chossy but it get better further up.   The crux is 2/3 the way up with some good footwork needed to not barndoor. Most of the bad rock was cleaned before first ascent as the limestone in interior Alaska is fractured.
content.protection: 3/8" Bolts, with anchor bolts at top.
content.location: This climb is located on the far right of the Rubble Pile crag.

content.description: This crag is situated well off the main trail in the West Grapefruit area. The area is secluded and has great views of the surrounding environs. The rock isn't as slick as the rest of the area's limestone, but the rock tends to exfoliate on some of the routes. The routes are worthwhile and the setting is blissful.
